DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of the study is to compare two ultrasound-guided arterial cannulation procedures: in-plane infraclavicular axillary artery cannulation and out-of-plane femoral artery cannulation.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound-guided Axillary Artery Vs Femoral Artery Cannulation.
DOC.criteria: mechanically ventilated critically ill patients with indications for artery cannulation in whom radial artery cannulation is unable to perform age less than 18 years trauma and hematoma at the catheterization site clinically significant coagulation disorders infection at the catheterization site lack of patients or closest relatives contents BMI > 35 kg/m2 precedent surgery operation into the femoral and axillary arteries clinically significant ischemia of the limb at the cannulation side
